elements.2211.03086_9178ff9df70cc7df1a743ee629c00: Already in the 1940s, surveys of the sky at radio frequencies were conducted

elements.2211.03086_d41f835222093ce74e635b43d3e53: These maps show strong point-like sources as well as the diffuse radio emission from the Galaxy
elements.2211.03086_7d9932961e4a45b3b42a673dee545: The original motivation for this was to get a better understanding of the Galaxy and also to use the information from the maps in studies in the fields of astronomy and astrophysics, e.g.
elements.2211.03086_7451d66de53852242701d9f8d7ad5: related to the cosmic microwave background

elements.2211.03086_8725970a6dc9f41f16c528befed13: These sky models recently became relevant in the field of astroparticle physics for the absolute calibration of radio detection arrays
elements.2211.03086_94f08766f7d8f7c373788ada2a90a: Over the past years, the radio detection technique has gained increasing importance for the observation of highly energetic cosmic rays and neutrinos detected through the radio emission from particle cascades
elements.2211.03086_ecf8dc9e253b96615e188c5245b22: A number of promising radio detection arrays for the measurement of cosmic particles in the frequency range from a few tens to hundreds of MHz are in the phase of development or under construction (e.g.

elements.2211.03086_396b19e96f2b31b84445e82f649ab: , the Giant Radio Array for Neutrino Detection (GRAND)
elements.2211.03086_ca1dca8a36a77ec14a6ecfc83406a: ) while some are already taking data (e.g.
elements.2211.03086_08caec01e1dd397f0d26aa0db1e64: For extracting physics it is very important to accurately determine the absolute energy scale of the detected particle cascades
elements.2211.03086_4f88dd00fb5f485255d2c0cfa18e6: and therefore an accurate calibration of the radio detectors is required
elements.2211.03086_8b12dc07c45971c99213d0f185f40: Calibrating with a reference antenna emitting a defined signal (e.g.
elements.2211.03086_440cbf662bb48e57ac5b4873e8a6a: ) has the disadvantage of uncertainties on the emitted signal strength which are difficult to assess
elements.2211.03086_9dfc038318fbfdc15cfe748d8fb4e: Also, dedicated calibration campaigns require significant effort and are almost impossible to perform on a regular basis for large arrays
elements.2211.03086_94cfecb49682694d8ef1ea6e800cf: A different calibration approach uses the diffuse Galactic radio emission
elements.2211.03086_1c092762c4a0c1e318fe36670bc92: which poses a natural background to the detection of radio emission from particle showers
elements.2211.03086_5db3ef8be2d45fd06182c086f7fb9: It typically poses the dominant background from natural sources at these frequencies
elements.2211.03086_2c23da0e6ab06a65b036173a00deb: This so-called Galactic Calibration also offers the opportunity to directly compare the calibration of different radio arrays as they at least partially see the same sky
elements.2211.03086_d6865398afa7037f1638f5616bf70: Moreover, the method can be applied as regularly as background data is available and does not require special field campaigns
elements.2211.03086_9ce159fdd54bf577e93decb2463ab: The Galactic Calibration was already applied to the LOFAR low-band antennas
elements.2211.03086_85dfbb5574aef0b7d3a77e254339f: and to the engineering array of the new radio detector of the Pierre Auger Observatory
elements.2211.03086_be16464a75a33e8ec0b40d775349d: In the Galactic Calibration, the measured background signal from the Galaxy is compared to predictions made with the aforementioned sky models
elements.2211.03086_08f7f1bd9a987cd5988b44ab821b5: Knowing the uncertainty on these predictions is thus crucial for a useful absolute calibration

elements.2211.03086_77a344b2e96aa9f31130607631343: In the past years, a couple of models for predicting the diffuse foreground emission of the sky in the radio and microwave regimes were developed with the purpose of calibrating radio arrays or removing this foreground emission from measurements of the cosmic microwave background
elements.2211.03086_e18e8abd9a9237df6ad08e4d99fa2: These models interpolate between reference sky surveys at various frequencies conducted with telescopes at different locations

elements.2211.03086_fdd6dd5b5e9d81c4fcd8e7b8abcc9: This study gives estimates for the systematic uncertainty in predicting the diffuse Galactic radio emission in the
elements.2211.03086_3fc9fdcf5335960fdf94dd1e8ebfe: Moreover, it provides an overview of the available models that are used for making these predictions and their corresponding reference measurements
elements.2211.03086_4075ecf66dde5d1fb7ea65af26ef7: A considerable realization from this overview is that probably a significant level of correlation exists between the systematic uncertainties of the sky models and the reference maps
elements.2211.03086_ae2788acf0c9307f01cca582bad43: Some reference maps served as calibrators for other maps and have thus an increased weight in the sky interpolation models
elements.2211.03086_35ad2d333ed374c4b9804b5a00cc9: In general, for the sky models considered here, there is no substantial attention paid to weighting the individual reference maps during the modeling process, which can lead to biases on the absolute temperature scale
elements.2211.03086_6fba5bda3f3f86cb5cd075132d027: These biases are almost impossible to untangle
elements.2211.03086_5a2317022bae01737d7747d840078: The generally small number of reference maps in the studied frequency range further complicates the situation
elements.2211.03086_49ab3ca4c5a204075669591325caa: While many surveys include a careful treatment of their uncertainties, others lack this kind of thoroughness, which in some cases may just be a consequence of the age of these surveys and the unavailability of some tools and techniques at the time of their execution
elements.2211.03086_da4f7366646623ed0f9f7a6d33100: In the future, these difficulties can be coped with by including more and newer reference maps into the sky interpolation models and weighting them based on their inherited uncertainties
elements.2211.03086_30b1a7feae821858e8b69a56a5832: New sky surveys at MHz frequencies are on the horizon or were recently published, including direct comparisons to other maps or sky models
elements.2211.03086_eee47bd4cdcb0f6cb8101d4ff15a8: Regarding the application of the Galactic Calibration for radio arrays in astroparticle physics, we argue that the viability of this method is given if systematic uncertainties are carefully taken care of, which means that the parameters of the considered radio array are important
elements.2211.03086_5470e2f55a52dea02a7f760771cd2: From our studies, we see that the Galactic Calibration exhibits larger uncertainties at higher frequencies
elements.2211.03086_0cc19daa960eeb32c8c23ea966bc6: There, the Galaxy's contribution to the radio background diminishes and sources like the Sun become stronger
elements.2211.03086_0335e6fcd03a7af3d5e9f3548d02a: In the case of an array with a large frequency band, it might be a solution to conduct the Galactic Calibration only with night-time measurements to minimize systematic uncertainties.

elements.2211.03086_df773ded922c23c37db1c9640d028: Jupiter is a source of radio emission with a unique and dynamic spectrum dominated by several components of nonthermal emission

elements.2211.03086_660a5606fe4f6fd4f5866e5ba28f8: up to which frequency Jupiter emits intense decametric (DAM) radio waves
elements.2211.03086_7e8b5696bd718b964ce3199a504e1: Jovian DAM emission occurs in irregular intervals with time scales of minutes and hours
elements.2211.03086_f5c7def3519b235b4ca7c099387fb: The antennas of the radio detectors considered in this work have a rather wide beam and a potential signal from Jupiter would always enter these together with a large-scale contribution from the Galaxy
elements.2211.03086_2449e537f83e419b48f668c936e9e: Because of this and due the cutoff in its emission spectrum, Jupiter can be safely ignored above

elements.2211.03086_ff2d6cfa21afc50de5ee2a81ed14a: We advocate a dedicated analysis that takes into account the antenna gain pattern as well as the temporal features of Jupiter's spectrum
elements.2211.03086_4cf31b2a55f8fc811fd3fde3d45c5: The probability for an observer to see Jovian emission at a specific time can be predicted well, for example using the Jupiter Radio Probability Tool
